title: Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Plan Your Visit      The Carter G. Woodson Home National Historic Site is a new unit of the National Park Service, acquired in 2005. It is in need of rehabilitation and restoration and is closed to the public, however, the public is able to view the outside building facade. The Mary McLeod Bethune Council House National Historic Site serves as the temporary visitor center for the Woodson home.
